page.title: 20Local History Priors Marston
page.content: The Falcon Inn has been a hostlery for travellers for over 300 years. Several stone houses built within half a century of each other indicate an influx of wealth in the mid 16th century, associated with the wool trade from Banbury on the edge of the Cotswolds. The enclosures award of 1758 set the modern pattern of the parish although the fields have been greatly altered by modern farming methods in the last 20 years. The Lord of the Manor is Earl Spencer. Royalist troops are recorded as being billeted in the village at the time of the Civil War as indeed were servicemen during both World Wars. Master Clockmaker Blencow Churchill lived & worked here in the mid 17th century, and Master Chairmaker Edward Gardiner in the mid 19th century.
